comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to www.nps.gov/archive/gett/getttour/sidebar/reunion13.htm this would be July 4, 1913. According to www1.american.edu/heintze/FourthPres.htm "1913- President Wilson is at Gettysburg giving a Fourth of July battle reunion speech. After one hour, he leaves by train for New York on way to Cornish, N.H. to spend a few days with his family." This looks like a train to me. And here is the itinerary of his trip: wwl2.dataformat.com/PDF/D06867.pdf

comment.author: 35122993@N08
comment._content: Thank you swanq. We'll update this record and other related photos of the reunion event.
